xocs:funding-list.xocs:funding-text: Manuscript received January 24, 2021; revised April 26, 2021; accepted June 3, 2021. Date of publication June 9, 2021; date of current version June 22, 2021. This work was supported in part by the National Natural Science Foundation of China under Grant 62061032, in part by the Outstanding Youth Fund of Jiangxi Province under Grant 20192ACB21032, in part by the Jiangxi Science Foundation under Grant 20202BABL202038, and in part by the Nanchang Hangkong University Graduate Innovation Special Fund Project under Grant YC2019022. The associate editor coordinating the review of this manuscript and approving it for publication was Dr. Minglun Gong. (Corresponding author: Shan Gai.) The authors are with the School of Information and Engineering, Nan-chang Hangkong University, Nanchang 330063, China (e-mail: tastesogood@ 163.com; gaishan@nchu.edu.cn). Digital Object Identifier 10.1109/LSP.2021.3088049

affiliation.ce:source-text: School of Information and Engineering, Nanchang Hangkong University, Nanchang, China

head.citation-title: Reduced Biquaternion Stacked Denoising Convolutional AutoEncoder for RGB-D Image Classification
head.abstracts: Â© 1994-2012 IEEE.RGB-D image classification based on convolutional neural networks have been extensively explored recently. However, they suffer from problems of effective representation of RGB-D image, intra-class variances and inter-class similarities. To address these problems, this letter proposes a novel RGB-D image classification framework based on reduced biquaternion stacked denoising convolutional autoencoder (RQ-SDCAE). The proposed framework can encode and extract the depth feature effectively by using the reduced biquaternion. The stacked training method is utilized to train the proposed reduced biquaternion convolutional autoencoder. Extensive evaluations for RGB-D image classification demonstrate that RQ-SDCAE outperforms the state-of-the-art methods.

affiliation.ce:source-text: School of Information and Engineering, Nanchang Hangkong University, Nanchang, China

coredata.dc:description: RGB-D image classification based on convolutional neural networks have been extensively explored recently. However, they suffer from problems of effective representation of RGB-D image, intra-class variances and inter-class similarities. To address these problems, this letter proposes a novel RGB-D image classification framework based on reduced biquaternion stacked denoising convolutional autoencoder (RQ-SDCAE). The proposed framework can encode and extract the depth feature effectively by using the reduced biquaternion. The stacked training method is utilized to train the proposed reduced biquaternion convolutional autoencoder. Extensive evaluations for RGB-D image classification demonstrate that RQ-SDCAE outperforms the state-of-the-art methods.
coredata.dc:title: Reduced Biquaternion Stacked Denoising Convolutional AutoEncoder for RGB-D Image Classification
coredata.dc:publisher: Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers Inc.
